workflow.name: Draft and manage academic research papers with GPT-4 and Pinecone
workflow.description:
## How It Works
This workflow automates academic research processing by routing queries through specialized AI models while maintaining contextual memory. Designed for researchers, faculty, and graduate students, it solves the challenge of managing multiple AI models for different research tasks while preserving conversation context across sessions. The system accepts research queries via webhook, stores them in vector databases for semantic search, and intelligently routes requests to appropriate AI models (OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, or NVIDIA NIM). Results are consolidated, formatted, and delivered via email with full citation tracking. The workflow maintains conversation history using Pinecone vector storage, enabling follow-up queries that reference previous interactions. This eliminates manual model switching, context loss, and repetitive credential management—streamlining research workflows from literature review to hypothesis generation.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure Pinecone credentials  
2. Add OpenAI API key for GPT-4 access and embeddings
3. Set up Anthropic Claude API credentials for advanced reasoning
4. Configure NVIDIA NIM API key for specialized academic models
5. Connect Google Sheets for query logging and result tracking
6. Set Gmail OAuth credentials for automated result delivery
7. Configure webhook URL for query submission endpoint
 
## Prerequisites
Active accounts and API keys for Pinecone, OpenAI 
## Use Cases
Literature review automation with semantic paper discovery. 
## Customization
Modify AI model selection logic for domain-specific optimization.
## Benefits
Reduces research processing time by 60% through automated routing.

workflow.name: AI-Powered Academic Research Intelligence and Publication Management System

options.systemMessage:
You are an advanced research intelligence agent specializing in academic analysis.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the provided research papers, patents, datasets, and technical blogs
2. Perform AI-driven summarization of each source
3. Identify key themes and cluster related research
4. Conduct citation graph analysis to identify influential works
5. Detect novel contributions and research gaps
6. Identify hypothesis gaps and potential research directions
7. Extract methodological approaches and their consistency

Return your analysis in structured JSON format with fields: summary, themes, clusters, citations, novelty_score, research_gaps, hypothesis_gaps, methodology.

You are a manuscript drafting agent specialized in academic writing.

Your task is to:
1. Draft publication-ready manuscripts based on research analysis
2. Ensure methodological consistency throughout the document
3. Maintain proper citation integrity using the Citation Reference Store tool
4. Structure the manuscript with: Abstract, Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, Conclusion
5. Apply academic writing standards and clarity
6. Ensure all claims are properly cited

Use the Citation Reference Store tool to look up and verify citations. Return the manuscript in structured format with sections.

parameters.toolDescription: Search and retrieve citation references from the knowledge base

documentId.value: <__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Google Sheets document ID for research database__>
<__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Google Sheets document ID for submission tracking__>
<__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Google Sheets document ID for reviewer feedback__>

options.systemMessage:
You are a format adaptation agent for academic manuscripts.

Your task is to:
1. Adapt the manuscript to different journal or conference formats
2. Apply specific formatting guidelines (IEEE, ACM, APA, Nature, etc.)
3. Adjust citation styles according to target venue
4. Modify structure to match venue requirements
5. Ensure compliance with word limits and section requirements

Return the formatted manuscript maintaining all content integrity.

You are a learning optimization agent that analyzes publication outcomes.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze acceptance and rejection patterns from reviewer feedback
2. Identify successful research directions and methodologies
3. Extract insights on what makes manuscripts successful
4. Recommend optimization strategies for future research
5. Track trends in reviewer preferences and requirements
6. Suggest improvements to research approach and writing style

Return actionable insights and recommendations in structured format.

documentId.value: <__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Google Sheets document ID for learning insights__>

parameters.content:
## Document Ingestion 
Extracts text from PDFs and academic papers using multiple extraction methods for reliability.
## Why:
Ensures comprehensive text capture from diverse document formats, preventing data loss from complex academic formatting.

## Prerequisites
Active accounts and API keys for Pinecone, OpenAI 
## Use Cases
Literature review automation with semantic paper discovery. 
## Customization
Modify AI model selection logic for domain-specific optimization.
## Benefits
Reduces research processing time by 60% through automated routing.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure Pinecone credentials  
2. Add OpenAI API key for GPT-4 access and embeddings
3. Set up Anthropic Claude API credentials for advanced reasoning
4. Configure NVIDIA NIM API key for specialized academic models
5. Connect Google Sheets for query logging and result tracking
6. Set Gmail OAuth credentials for automated result delivery
7. Configure webhook URL for query submission endpoint

## How It Works
This workflow automates academic research processing by routing queries through specialized AI models while maintaining contextual memory. Designed for researchers, faculty, and graduate students, it solves the challenge of managing multiple AI models for different research tasks while preserving conversation context across sessions. The system accepts research queries via webhook, stores them in vector databases for semantic search, and intelligently routes requests to appropriate AI models (OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, or NVIDIA NIM). Results are consolidated, formatted, and delivered via email with full citation tracking. The workflow maintains conversation history using Pinecone vector storage, enabling follow-up queries that reference previous interactions. This eliminates manual model switching, context loss, and repetitive credential management—streamlining research workflows from literature review to hypothesis generation.

## Vector Storage 
Embeds processed content into Pinecone vector database with metadata tagging.
## Why:
Enables semantic search across research corpus, allowing contextually relevant retrieval rather than keyword matching.

## AI Routing 
Analyzes query complexity and routes to OpenAI GPT-4, Claude, or NVIDIA models based on task requirements.
## Why: 
Optimizes cost and performance by matching specialized models to specific research tasks.

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
